title.narrative: Strengthening biofarming approaches for additional income and social security of farmer families

description.narrative: The problem which will be addressed is developing farming communities in southern India especially in regard to ecological farming. The agricultural education will be strengthened. Training and demonstrations for 300 women beneficiaries in the farming comm unity will be organised yearly in six villages. The objective is to train the women in taking better use of chemical free manures insecticides pesticides and to cultivate organically and eco-friendly. Economically important plants and trees will be planted on the hedges of the farming area and the dwelling places. Through trainings and demonstrations multiple and intercropping patterns are used. Preparing of compost and vermicompost for recycling of farm wastes will be demonstrated and made on the farms. T hus farming is made profitable and suitable for future generations and ecologically beneficial to the community as a whole. Establishment of demonstration units for horticulture floriculture and poultry are organized as well as a beekeeping unit in the par tner's premises.Awareness trainings are planned in timely insemination of livestock awareness of ill effects of open defecation and drinking of polluted water. Other training issues are hygiene health and nutrition. The importance of education is stressed. Children from 5 to 15 years go to school. During three years 900 women beneficiaries will be empowered to unite and form self help groups. Within self help groups the women beneficiaries are encouraged to regular savings and individual entrepreneurial act ivities. Through self help groups linked to Commercial Banks for subsidy loans and savings the women from six different villages will get additional income become economically self reliant and acquainted with social activities.
